intro: Ageratum munaense, commonly known as Muna ageratum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces blue to violet flowers with white or pale yellow centers, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Ageratum munaense prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
